bibl.title: Taka Shibata v. Henry M. White. Order Admitting to Bail
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington
Filed in the United States District Court
In re Taka Shilbata, Application for Habeas Corpus.
In this cause upon the application of Counsel for petitioner, The United States Attorney appearing for the Commissioner of Immigration; it is by the court

ORDERED that pending the final disposition of petition herein, that the petitioner Taka Shilbata, be, and she is hereby admitted to bail in the sum of $500.00, conditioned for her appearance in Court to abide by and perform the final judgment of the court entered herein; said bail to be given either in cash or in Liberty Bonds; and it appearing to the court that the petitioner has deposited with the U.S.Immigration Commissioner, bonds in the sum of $500.00 and that the same are still in the custody of the said Commissioner of Immigration, it is by the court

ORDERED that said Liberty Bonds now on deposit with the U.S.Commissioner of Immigration,stand as the bail of said petitioner herein, and that the said bonds be retained by Henry M.White, U.S.Commissioner of Immigration, at the Port of Seattle, as and for the bail of said petitioner hereunder.
Done in Open Court this 14th day of July, 1920.
3 briefs and Immigration office record send to Judge Rudkin
